poem:
"At the Brink of the Ballot Box"

Rishi Sunak maps a path 
through the jungle of dissent, 
His orchestra of MPs, tuning their voices 
to the key of unity. 

Behind him, the ghostly echo of desks  
bang in agreement, 
Yet the specter of a brutal vote looms, 
Unfazed by his whispered harmonies,
waiting for the morning melody of the voters.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Rishi Sunak urges his MPs to present unified front before local elections Rishi Sunak has sought to unify his fractious party ahead of what could be a brutal set of local elections, urging his MPs to ignore dissenting voices and present a coherent front. The prime minister’s address to the 1922 Committee of Conservative backbenchers gave the appearance of agreement, with much of the traditional banging of desks and no public criticism, although some attenders". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
